column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Proof that there are great art museums in the States. This is one of my favorites and trip after trip I still love going and could stay all day. The highlights for me are the Impressionist collection
column2: the Georgia O'Keeffe collection (do not miss her clouds in the stair well) and Chagall's stained glass windows. They have been moved to a new wing since my first visits when I was a kid (and since Ferris Bueller's visit). And
column4: take some time to visit Seurat's "A Sunday on La Grande Jatte". Their collection also includes some of the other best known American pieces including "Nighthawks" and "American Gothic".
